meanings.definition: To compare; to be a model of excellence.
meanings.sent1: She paragoned her artwork with that of the famous painter.
meanings.sent2: The new sculpture paragoned the beauty of nature perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The cat paragoned its hunting skills with those of a lion.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his craft paragoned a master craftsman.
meanings.sent5: The student's essay paragoned the writing skills of a published author.

meanings.definition: To be a perfect example of something.
meanings.sent1: The bright star paragoned the twinkling lights in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: Her kindness paragoned the generosity of a saint.
meanings.sent3: The cake paragoned a fluffy cloud in its lightness.
meanings.sent4: His voice paragoned the soothing sound of a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The flower paragoned the beauty of a blooming rose garden.
